settings.title: UTI 101

settings.text: A UTI (urinary tract infection, also known as cystitis or bladder infection) is an infection in any part of your urinary system. While both men and women can experience the discomfort of a UTI, women tend to suffer from them more often. Female urethras are shorter than those of a male and the anus is located closer to it, making it easier for bacteria to travel up into the bladder and kidneys. If the bacteria doesn’t get removed, it can cause irritation, which will lead to infection. Without treatment, UTIs can lead to more serious conditions.

settings.title: Did you know?
settings.text_1: UTIs are responsible for nearly 10 million doctor visits each year
settings.text_2: 60% of women will experience a UTI at least once
settings.text_3: 25% of women will have chronic UTIs

settings.title: Ways to Prevent UTIs in your everyday routine
settings.text_1: The more water you drink, the more often you urinate. That means your urinary tract is continuously being flushed of potentially harmful bacteria that could cause an infection.
settings.text_2: Peeing flushes out any harmful bacteria that might have been spread around while you were doing the deed.
settings.text_3: Women are more prone to UTIs because the anus is located close to the urethra. When you go to the bathroom, make sure you always wipe from front to back (and use that paper once per swipe!) so that you don't spread any harmful bacteria.

settings.text_1: Wearing tight pants traps heat and moisture around your “down there”, which creates a favourable environment for bacteria to grow.
settings.title_2: Change your feminine hygiene products often
settings.text_2: It can get a little hot and sweaty down there when Aunt Flo comes to town. Replacing your pads or tampons often prevents those pesky bacteria from getting too comfortable.
settings.text_3: There are many natural options to consider, and Utiva provides doctor-proven options to help maintain a healthy urinary tract by promoting the natural flushing of bacteria.

settings.title: What causes a UTI?
settings.text:
Simply put, urinary tract infections are caused by a breach in the body's natural defense system, which causes an overgrowth in bacteria in any part of the urinary tract such as the urethra, bladder, or kidneys. 

There are certain specific conditions that cause an overgrowth of bacteria. Warm temperatures, moisture, environmental pH and oxygen create a breeding ground for bacteria and resulting in UTIs.

A small portion of the population suffers from urinary tract infections on a recurring basis — either every few months or weeks. In order to successfully prevent urinary tract infections from coming back, it's important to find out what's causing them in the first place!

settings.title: Other common causes of UTIs. Read more in our Youtiva Blog
UTI symptoms
settings.text:
Are you experiencing any of the following? We’re here to help. 

☐ Strong and frequent urge to urinate;
☐ Pain or a burning sensation when you pee;
☐ Cloudy, bloody, or strong-smelling urine;
☐ Fever and chills;
☐ Nausea and vomiting;
☐ Feeling very tired or shaking;
☐ Muscle aches, abdominal pain or lower back pain.

settings.title: Meet Derek & Faraz, co-founders of Utiva.
settings.text:
Our vision is to enable consumers to self-test and self-manage a UTI in the comfort of their homes. Early-detection through rapid tests and offering natural options that are clinically proven to maintain a healthy urinary tract and help you live your life.

UTIs hit close to home in a real way.  Our determination roots from personal exposure with our families that continue to inspire us every day. Here are our stories...

settings.title: Derek’s story
settings.text: A few years ago, I was woken up by my phone in the middle of the night. Before my wife left on a trip, a doctor had prescribed her antibiotics to treat a UTI but little did we know that she was resistant to that antibiotic. The infection ended up traveling to her kidneys and she was now hospitalized on her trip. Here I was, on the other side of the world unable to help her.

settings.title: Faraz’s Story
settings.text:
I still remember when my dad shared the difficult news that my grandma had passed away.  In her health she had neglected the symptoms of a Urinary Tract Infection thinking it was something you live with after menopause. This taboo subject, inconvenient access to care and her own ignorance lead her to keep suffering privately. As a result, she had lost one of her kidneys and had severe complications since.

Our goal is to ensure that every single customer gets the best support, education and care at Utiva. Whether it’s through our products, community or tools, we hope you find something to help you on your UTI journey. You are not alone!

settings.title: Is Utiva Cranberry PACs safe for people who have a history of kidney stones?
settings.text: Most cranberry products are known to have high levels of Oxalates which can aggravate kidney stones as the majority of kidney stones are formed when oxalate binds to calcium while urine is produced by the kidneys. Utiva Cranberry PACs is unique because it only has trace amounts of Oxalates due to our unique extraction process.  We also do third party testing of our formulation to verify oxalate levels. Therefore, Utiva is safer for people with history of kidney stones. However, we do recommend checking with your doctor before starting any new supplement.

settings.title: Is Utiva Cranberry PACs a treatment for UTIs?
settings.text: No. Treatment of UTIs is still recommended to be antibiotics due to the evidence available. Natural products are recommended for maintaining a healthy urinary tract.

settings.text: There are no known side effects with Utiva Cranberry PACs unless you are allergic to cranberries. Typically cranberry products are known to have high levels of Vitamin K and Oxalates. These can interfere with blood thinners and aggravate kidney stones. Utiva Cranberry PACs has removed the Vitamin K and only has trace amounts of Oxalates.

settings.title: Probiotic FAQ
Does the Probiotic work?
settings.text: Yes! Utiva’s Probiotic is an excellent probiotic option providing necessary strains to improve gut and urinary tract health. At the total value of 30 Billion CFU, at time of manufacture, the optimal required amount of probiotics are being provided. Additionally, our DR Capsules are vegetable based and specially created to ensure delivery of sensitive probiotic strains past the gut for targeted delivery.

settings.title: How long do I have to wait to see the effects?
settings.text: It is usually recommended to take natural products for a minimum of 4 weeks to see beneficial results but some will experience health benefits much earlier. It is important to take your Probiotic diligently every day to ensure optimal efficacy. Probiotics are often a long term process to regain and maintain your optimal gut health so please be patient!

settings.title: Does the Probiotic interact with other supplements and antibiotics?
settings.text: When taking antibiotics, it is recommended to take any probiotic 2-3 hours before/after taking your antibiotic. Aside from this, there are no known interactions with Probiotic and any other medication or supplements.

settings.title: Do I need to refrigerate Probiotic ?
settings.text: No. Utiva Probiotic is shelf stable at room temperature. Being individually packed in blister packs also ensures improved stability with less exposure to air. Should you wish to refrigerate it, there is no harm in doing so.

settings.title: D-Mannose FAQ
How does D-Mannose work?
settings.text: D-Mannose is a form of sugar that may prevent UTIs by stopping bacteria from attaching to the bladder lining. It is believed that D-Mannose attaches itself to the E.coli strain, which accounts for over 70% of all UTI-causing bacteria. There have been clinical studies to show that D-Mannose is effective along with feedback from doctors and consumers that D-Mannose helps to prevent UTIs. Even though evidence is limited, and it is not in UTI prevention guidelines, it can certainly help those facing chronic and/or trigger associated UTIs.

settings.title: What’s the difference between D-Mannose and Cranberry PACs?
settings.text:
D-Mannose is another high-quality supplement for UTI prevention from Utiva which focuses on the E.coli bacteria. We recommend it when someone has complicated recurrent UTIs or has trigger-associated UTIs (such as sex, swimming, travel, etc). It recommended to take at least 2,000mg daily of D-Mannose.

Utiva Cranberry PACs is a clinically proven cranberry extract that binds to most bacteria, including E.coli. PACs are the bioactive molecule of the cranberry and physician guidelines recommend it. Urinary Tract Health Control is a simple, small, once-a-day pill taken for daily support of the urinary tract to prevent ongoing UTIs. PACs are also the antioxidant of the cranberry and provide other gut health benefits.

For those patients who are chronic and are looking for a stronger approach to prevent UTIs, we recommend taking Urinary Tract Health Control and D-Mannose together.

settings.title: Can I take D-Mannose and Utiva Cranberry PACs  at the same time?
settings.text: We recommend taking D-Mannose a few hours apart from Cranberry PACs. There is research that discusses how d-mannose and PACs could have their effectiveness reduced when taken together. We are investigating this further. With complicated or trigger associated UTI patients, doctors often recommend both products together with a probiotic.

settings.title: What role does D-Mannose have with IC (interstitial cystitis)?
settings.text: If you are having UTIs and feel there is a likelihood that the acidity of cranberry can irritate you, D-Mannose is a great option to consider. It will help fight specifically against Ecoli infections and has minimal impact on pH levels causing little to no irritation.

settings.title: What are the side effects of D-Mannose?
settings.text:
Side effects of D-Mannose may include bloating and loose stools. There is evidence that D-mannose may impact sugar levels, so people living with diabetes may want to consult a physician first. High doses of D-Mannose may also cause kidney damage.


Always tell your doctor about any supplements you are taking, including natural ones and those bought without a prescription. That way, your doctor can check on any potential side effects or interactions with any medications.

settings.title: UTI Test Strips FAQ
Can I use these UTI Test Strips instead of going to see my doctor?
settings.text: The UTI test strips are convenient and easy to use for screening a UTI in the comfort of your home.  It is advisable to use it only if you experience any of the UTI symptoms. If you show a positive result, you must immediately see your doctor. However, if you show a negative result but have symptoms, we still advise you to consult with your healthcare provider.

settings.title: How accurate is the test?
settings.text: The Utiva UTI test strips are clinically accurate. These rapid tests are similar to what some clinics use to quickly screen for a UTI before doing a urine culture.  The results of the UTI test strips have been compared to another commercial test. The study shows 94.4% accuracy for the Leukocyte test and 98.4% for the Nitrite test.

settings.title: How do I interpret the results?
settings.text:
Once you have urinated on the Utiva UTI test strip mid-stream or dipped the test strip in a collection of urine. Start a timer for 2 minutes.  

Start off by referencing the colour chart that is on the front of the test strip package. The top pad of the test strip tests for Leukocytes and the bottom pad tests for Nitrates.

You will want to read the result and look for a color change at one minute for Nitrate (bottom pad) and two minutes for Leukocytes (top pad). 

Read the results by comparing and matching the test pad(s) to the colour blocks on the colour chart. The chart indicates which colour block combinations suggest a negative or positive result. 

If you test positive, you should immediately consult a doctor. If you are unsure of your results, consult your physician and do not ignore your UTI symptoms.

settings.title: Is there a time that is best to take the test?
settings.text: Yes, the best time to perform the test is with the first morning urine. However if that is not possible based on when the UTI symptoms present themselves, you can use this UTI test anytime during the day. The UTI test should be avoided during your menstrual period.

settings.title: Do certain foods, alcohol or common medications affect the test?
settings.text: In general, most substances will not interfere with the test. Consult your physician if you are taking antibiotics. Some medications (e.g. Vitamin B2) can affect the colour of your urine and may cause false results. Large quantities of Vitamin C may cause false negative results.

settings.title: Are there limitations of the UTI Test?
settings.text: Yes. Under certain conditions, you may receive a negative test result even though you have a UTI. This can be due to a few reasons: your UTI is caused by bacteria that does not change nitrate to nitrite, when urine has not been held in the bladder for more than 4 hours, when taking antibiotics, or when your diet does not include nitrates.

settings.title: Can men use these UTI Test Strips?
settings.text: Absolutely! Utiva UTI Test Strips can be used by anyone.

settings.title: UTI 101
What is a UTI?
settings.text:
A urinary tract infection, commonly referred to as a UTI, is an infection found in any part of your urinary system. Though most UTIs are typically in the lower urinary tract within the bladder and the urethra.,

While both men and women can experience the trouble of a UTI, women tend to suffer from them more often. This is because female urethras are shorter than those of a male. The female's anus is positioned closer to the urethra, making it easier for E. Coli, the most common bacteria known to develop UTIs, to travel up into the bladder and kidneys.

settings.title: Who Can Get a UTI?
settings.text:
Anyone can get a UTI. Around 50–60% of women will endure a UTI in their lifetime. Just 3% of males will experience one. While UTIs are not an STD, they can occur if you are sexually active or have contracted chlamydia or gonorrhea. Even if you are abstinent, anything that brings bacteria into contact with your urethra can cause a UTI. For example, UTIs are a principal reason doctors tell women to wipe from front to back after a washroom trip! 

You're more likely to get a UTI if you:


○ have had one before
○ have diabetes
○ suffer from obesity
○ utilize a spermicide or a diaphragm
○ have kidney stones or another urinary tract obstruction

settings.title: Did you know?
settings.text_1: UTIs are responsible for nearly 10 million doctor visits each year
settings.text_2: 60% of women will experience a UTI at least once
settings.text_3: 25% of women will have chronic UTIs

settings.title: Ways to Prevent UTIs in your everyday routine
settings.text_1: The more water you drink, the more often you urinate. That means your urinary tract is continuously being flushed of potentially harmful bacteria that could cause an infection.
settings.text_2: Peeing flushes out any harmful bacteria that might have been spread around while you were doing the deed.
settings.text_3: Women are more prone to UTIs because the anus is located close to the urethra. When you go to the bathroom, make sure you always wipe from front to back (and use that paper once per swipe!) to avoid spreading any harmful bacteria.

settings.text_1: Wearing tight pants traps heat and moisture 'down there,' which creates a favorable environment for bacteria to grow.
settings.title_2: Change your feminine hygiene products often
settings.text_2: It can get a little hot and sweaty down there during your menstruation cycle. Replacing your pads or tampons often prevents those pesky bacteria from getting too comfortable.
settings.text_3: There are many natural options to consider, and Utiva provides doctor-proven options to help maintain a healthy urinary tract by promoting the natural flushing of bacteria.

settings.title: What Causes Urinary Tract Infections? (UTI)
settings.text:
Simply put, urinary tract infections are caused by a breach in the body's natural defence system, which causes overgrowth in bacteria in any part of the urinary tract such as the urethra, bladder, or kidneys.

Certain specific conditions cause an overgrowth of bacteria, such as warm temperatures, moisture, environmental pH, and oxygen, creating a breeding ground for bacteria and resulting in UTIs.

A small portion of the population suffers from urinary tract infections regularly — either every few months or weeks. To successfully prevent urinary tract infections from coming back, it's essential to find out what's causing them in the first place!

settings.title: Other common causes of UTIs.
settings.text_1: One of the common reasons why UTIs are triggered is because of sex. "During sexual intercourse, thrusting can introduce bacteria up the urethra and into the bladder, increasing the risk of a UTI," explains Dr. Lakeisha Richardson, MD, OB-GYN. But don't worry, UTIs are not contagious, and you do not need to stop having sex!
settings.text_2: Recurrent UTIs are common among healthy women at midlife, as their hormones are evolving. As the estrogen hormone allows the good bacteria to thrive and keep the harmful bacteria at bay, UTIs may become a regular occurrence in postmenopausal women.

settings.text_1: If you live with a spinal cord injury, you are likely aware that there is a higher risk of developing urinary tract infections. This is due to the necessity for catheters, or a sudden loss of bladder control.
settings.text_2: When faced with a UTI, both Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes can have serious implications when the body cannot fight off an infection or is up to twice as likely to develop urinary tract infections. This, coupled with higher probabilities of occurring with high blood glucose, UTIs can feel inevitable for some living with diabetes.

settings.title: What Are the Types of UTIs?
settings.text: Each type of UTI has a different name based on where it is in your urinary tract. Cystitis is an infection of the bladder. Urethritis is an infection of the urethra. Pyelonephritis is an infection of the kidneys. The most common UTIs occur mainly in women, affecting the bladder caused by E. coli, a type of bacteria commonly found in the gastrointestinal tract.

settings.title: What Are the Symptoms of a UTI?
settings.text:
Unfortunately, UTI symptoms can be overlooked or mistaken for something else, especially for older adults. Although many common signs include: 

○ Strong and frequent urge to urinate
○ Pain or a burning sensation when you pee
○ Cloudy, bloody, or strong-smelling urine
○ Fever and chills
○ Urinating frequently, but in small amounts
○ Nausea and vomiting
○ Feeling very tired or shaking
○ Muscle aches, abdominal pain, or lower back pain
○ Pelvic pain (in women)

settings.title: Stop UTIs before they start.
settings.text:
"Managing recurrent urinary tract infections can be complex. Antibiotics are the first-line treatment, but there are clinically proven options that can help prevent recurrences," explains Dr. Colleen Mcdermott, a Urogynecologist at Mount Sinai Hospital. "The evidence supports PACs as being the cranberry's active molecule, which prevents bacterial adherence to the bladder wall, thus reducing recurrent UTIs."

While antibiotics are essential for preventing a bacterial infection, they should be used sparingly, as you can become resistant to helpful antibiotics. The only way to reduce antibiotic usage is to prevent infections from occurring as best possible.

settings.title: UTI 101
What is a UTI?
settings.text:
A urinary tract infection, commonly referred to as a UTI, is an infection found in any part of your urinary system. Though most UTIs are typically in the lower urinary tract within the bladder and the urethra.

While both men and women can experience the trouble of a UTI, women tend to suffer from them more often. This is because female urethras are shorter than those of a male. The female's anus is positioned closer to the urethra, making it easier for E. Coli, the most common bacteria known to develop UTIs, to travel up into the bladder and kidneys.

settings.title: Who Can Get a UTI?
settings.text:
Anyone can get a UTI. Around 50–60% of women will endure a UTI in their lifetime. Just 3% of males will experience one. While UTIs are not an STD, they can occur if you are sexually active or have contracted chlamydia or gonorrhea. Even if you are abstinent, anything that brings bacteria into contact with your urethra can cause a UTI. For example, UTIs are a principal reason doctors tell women to wipe from front to back after a washroom trip! 

You're more likely to get a UTI if you:


○ have had one before
○ have diabetes
○ suffer from obesity 
○ utilize a spermicide or a diaphragm
○ have kidney stones or another urinary tract obstruction

settings.title: Did you know?
settings.text_1: UTIs are responsible for nearly 10 million doctor visits each year
settings.text_2: 60% of women will experience a UTI at least once
settings.text_3: 25% of women will have chronic UTIs

settings.title: Ways to Prevent UTIs in your everyday routine
settings.text_1: The more water you drink, the more often you urinate. That means your urinary tract is continuously being flushed of potentially harmful bacteria that could cause an infection.
settings.text_2: Peeing flushes out any harmful bacteria that might have been spread around while you were doing the deed.
settings.text_3: Women are more prone to UTIs because the anus is located close to the urethra. When you go to the bathroom, make sure you always wipe from front to back (and use that paper once per swipe!) to avoid spreading any harmful bacteria.

settings.text_1: Wearing tight pants traps heat and moisture 'down there,' which creates a favorable environment for bacteria to grow.
settings.title_2: Change your feminine hygiene products often
settings.text_2: Use this section to explain a set of product features, to link to a series of pages, or to answer common questions about your products. Add images for emphasis.
settings.text_3: There are many natural options to consider, and Utiva provides doctor-proven options to help maintain a healthy urinary tract by promoting the natural flushing of bacteria.

settings.title: What Causes Urinary Tract Infections (UTI)?
settings.text:
Simply put, urinary tract infections are caused by a breach in the body's natural defense system, which causes overgrowth in bacteria in any part of the urinary tract such as the urethra, bladder, or kidneys. 

Certain specific conditions cause an overgrowth of bacteria, such as warm temperatures, moisture, environmental pH, and oxygen, creating a breeding ground for bacteria and resulting in UTIs.

A small portion of the population suffers from urinary tract infections regularly — either every few months or weeks. To successfully maintain your urinary tract infections from coming back, it's essential to find out what's causing them in the first place!

settings.title: Other common causes of UTIs
settings.text_1: One of the common reasons why UTIs are triggered is because of sex. "During sexual intercourse, thrusting can introduce bacteria up the urethra and into the bladder, increasing the risk of a UTI," explains Dr. Lakeisha Richardson, MD, OB-GYN. But don't worry, UTIs are not contagious, and you do not need to stop having sex!
settings.text_2: Use this section to explain a set of product features, to link to a series of pages, or to answer common questions about your products. Add images for emphasis.

settings.text_1: If you live with a spinal cord injury, you are likely aware that there is a higher risk of developing urinary tract infections. This is due to the necessity for catheters, or a sudden loss of bladder control.
settings.text_2: When faced with a UTI, both Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes can have serious implications when the body cannot fight off an infection or is up to twice as likely to develop urinary tract infections. This, coupled with higher probabilities of occurring with high blood glucose, UTIs can feel inevitable for some living with diabetes.

settings.title: What Are the Types of UTIs?
settings.text: Each type of UTI has a different name based on where it is in your urinary tract. Cystitis is an infection of the bladder. Urethritis is an infection of the urethra. Pyelonephritis is an infection of the kidneys. The most common UTIs occur mainly in women, affecting the bladder caused by E. coli, a type of bacteria commonly found in the gastrointestinal tract.

settings.title: What Are the Symptoms of a UTI?
settings.text:
Unfortunately, UTI symptoms can be overlooked or mistaken for something else, especially for older adults. Although many common signs include:

○ Strong and frequent urge to urinate
○ Pain or a burning sensation when you pee
○ Cloudy, bloody, or strong-smelling urine
○ Fever and chills
○ Urinating frequently, but in small amounts
○ Nausea and vomiting
○ Feeling very tired or shaking
○ Muscle aches, abdominal pain, or lower back pain
○ Pelvic pain (in women)

settings.title: Going to a doctor to test if you have a UTI can be frustrating.
settings.text:
Utiva UTI Test Strips are an easy and convenient alternative to heading to the doctor's office when you feel a UTI coming on. Our FDA Approved strips give you a clinically accurate reading in just 2 minutes when you need to test for a UTI at home or while traveling.

Test safely and simply and then follow up with your doctor when needed!

Five Stars ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ ⭐ 

"Was super easy to use and gave accurate results. Super convenient, I didn't have to go into the doctor's office to do any additional tests and was able to get a prescription."

settings.title: UTI Management
settings.text:
"Managing recurrent urinary tract infections can be complex. Antibiotics are the first-line treatment but there are clinically proven options that can help manage recurrences," explains Dr. Colleen Mcdermott, a Urogynecologist. "The evidence supports PACs as being the cranberry's active molecule, which stops bacterial adherence to the bladder wall, thus reducing recurrent UTIs."

While antibiotics are essential for preventing a bacterial infection, they should be used sparingly, as you can become resistant to helpful antibiotics. The only way to reduce antibiotic usage is to prevent infections from occurring as best possible.

settings.text:

D-Mannose is a form of sugar that may prevent UTIs by stopping bacteria from attaching to the bladder lining. It is believed that D-Mannose attaches itself to the E.coli strain, which accounts for over 70% of all UTI-causing bacteria. There have been clinical studies to show that D-Mannose is effective along with feedback from doctors and consumers that D-Mannose helps to prevent UTIs. Even though evidence is limited, and it is not in UTI prevention guidelines, it can certainly help those facing chronic and/or trigger associated UTIs.

D-Mannose Attack is another high-quality supplement for UTI prevention from Utiva which focuses on the E.coli bacteria. We recommend it when someone has complicated recurrent UTIs or has trigger-associated UTIs (such as sex, swimming, travel, etc). It recommended to take at least 2,000mg daily of D-Mannose.

UTI Control 36mg PAC is a clinically proven cranberry extract that binds to most bacteria, including E.coli. PACs are the bioactive molecule of the cranberry and physician guidelines recommend it. UTI Control is a simple, small, once-a-day pill taken for daily support of the urinary tract to prevent ongoing UTIs. PACs are also the antioxidant of the cranberry and provide other gut health benefits.

For those patients who are chronic and are looking for a stronger approach to prevent UTIs, we recommend taking UTI Control and D-Mannose Attack together.

Yes, you can. They are both safe, natural options that can be effective in stopping all types of bacteria together. With complicated or trigger associated UTI patients, doctors often recommend both products together with a probiotic.

If you are having UTIs and feel there is a likelihood that the acidity of cranberry can irritate you, D-Mannose Attack is a great option to consider. It will help fight specifically against Ecoli infections and has minimal impact on pH levels causing little to no irritation.

There are no known side effects with Utiva UTI Control unless you are allergic to cranberries. Typcially cranberry products are known to have high levels of Vitamin K and Oxalates. These can interfere with blood thinners and aggravate kidney stones. Utiva UTI Control has removed the Vitamin K and only has trace amounts of Oxalates.

Side effects of D-Mannose may include bloating and loose stools. If you have diabetes, D- Mannose supplements should be used with caution as it may make it harder to control your blood sugar. High doses of D-Mannose may also cause kidney damage.

Always tell your doctor about any supplements you are taking, including natural ones and those bought without a prescription. That way, your doctor can check on any potential side effects or interactions with any medications.

settings.title: What are the ingredients in Utiva UTI Control?
settings.text: Each capsule of Utiva UTI Control contains 240mg of Urophenol™️ - Cranberry (Vaccinium macrocarpon) fruit extract providing 15% proanthocyanidins (PACs) = 36mg PAC per BL-DMAC method, Inactive Ingredents hypromellose, magnesium stearate, and rice flour

settings.title: Can Utiva UTI Control aggravate IC (Interstitial cystitis)?
settings.text: Cranberry can lower the pH and an acidic environment is know to aggravate IC. We do have many patients with IC though. Some take an alkaline agent as well to balance the pH and others just continue with it and so they can get the benefits of Utiva UTI Control. We advise you to consult your doctor regarding this.

settings.title: Why is Utiva UTI Control is so expensive?
settings.text: Unlike most cranberry products, Utiva UTI Control always discloses the amount of active molecules we have. In providing 36mg of PACs (measure by DMAC/A2) from cranberries, Utiva UTI Control is a clinically proven option to help prevent UTI's. This will help reduce the need for antibotics, which can have negative side effects, including antibiotic resistance.

settings.title: I can not swallow the capsule
settings.text: You can open capsule and put the powder in apple sauce, yogurt, juice, cereal, smoothie or anything you like. This makes it easier for kids or the elderly. We do not recommend putting Utiva UTI Control in anything hot.

settings.text: Most cranberry supplements have less than 5mg PACs and unlike most cranberry products, we at Utiva will always disclose the amount of active molecules we have. settings.title: Does the Probiotic Power work?
settings.text: Yes! Utiva’s Probiotic Power is an excellent probiotic option providing necessary strains to improve gut and urinary tract health. Additionally, our DR Capsules are vegetable based and specially created to ensure delivery of sensitive probiotic strains past the gut for targeted delivery.

settings.title: How long do I have to wait to see the effects?
settings.text: It is usually recommended to take natural products for a minimum of 4 weeks to see beneficial results but some will experience health benefits much earlier. It is important to take your Probiotic Power diligently every day to ensure optimal efficacy. Probiotics are often a long term process to regain and maintain your optimal gut health so please be patient!

settings.title: Does the Probiotic Power interact with other supplements and antibiotics?
settings.text: When taking antibiotics, it is recommended to take any probiotic 2-3 hours before/after taking your antibiotic. Aside from this, there are no known interactions with Probiotic Power and any other medication or supplements.

settings.title: Is it dairy-free and soy-free?
settings.text: Yes! Utiva Probiotic Power is dairy-free and soy-free. It is a very clean formulation that is safe for all adult populations.

settings.title: Do I need to refrigerate Probiotic Power?
settings.text: No. Utiva Probiotic Power is shelf stable at room temperature. Being individually packed in blister packs also ensures improved stability with less exposure to air. Should you wish to refrigerate it, there is no harm in doing so.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
settings.text: Use this section for any descriptive text you need to fill out your pages or to add introductory headings between other blocks.

settings.title: Does Utiva work?
settings.text: Utiva is a great option to prevent UTIs as our product guarantees 36mg of Proanthocyanidins (PACs for short). PACs have a special ability: anti-adhesion as it interferes with the harmful bacteria to stop them from sticking to the bladder wall, minimizing risk of infection. When taking Utiva daily, around the same time this results in natural flushing of bacteria when urinating. It is important to take Utiva around the same time as it works on a 24 hour cycle.

settings.title: What is the recommended dosage of Utiva UTI Control?
settings.text:
Utiva UTI Control is recommended to be taken as per the following:

PREVENTION: 1 capsule daily at the same time every day

SEX-ASSOCIATED or SYMPTOMATIC: 2 capsules the day of and 2 capsules 24 hours later. It is safe to take 2 capsules a day for a few days if needed.

Utiva UTI Control can be taken with or without food.

settings.title: Why Utiva UTI Test Strips?
settings.text: The same type of tests that most doctors use to diagnose a UTI. Utiva UTI Test Strips have 2 tests in one. It checks for Leukocyte (white blood cells) and Nitrite (presence of Ecoli) which are both things that signal if you have an UTI and give you results in just 2 minutes. Test safely and simply and then follow up with your doctor when needed.

settings.title: What is the UTI eBook?
settings.text: The Utiva UTI Guide eBook has been reviewed by specialists and has a message from Dr. Colleen McDermott, a well-renowned Urogynecologist at Mt Sinai Hospital who speaks towards the trouble with managing UTIs. This is a quick read covering a number of topics such as bladder friendly foods, exercise, fashion, sex, travel and more.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
What is the recommended dosage of Utiva UTI Control?
settings.text:
Utiva UTI Control is recommended to be taken as per the following:

PREVENTION: 1 capsule daily at the same time every day

SEX-ASSOCIATED or SYMPTOMATIC: 2 capsules the day of and 2 capsules 24 hours later. It is safe to take 2 capsules a day for a few days if needed.

Utiva UTI Control can be taken with or without food.

settings.title: What’s the difference between D-Mannose and UTI Control (36mg PAC)?
settings.text:
D-Mannose is another high-quality supplement for UTI prevention from Utiva which focuses on the E.coli bacteria. We recommend it when someone has complicated recurrent UTIs or has trigger-associated UTIs (such as sex, swimming, travel, etc). It recommended to take at least 2,000mg daily of D-Mannose.

UTI Control 36mg PAC is a clinically proven cranberry extract that binds to most bacteria, including E.coli. PACs are the bioactive molecule of the cranberry and physician guidelines recommend it. UTI Control is a simple, small, once-a-day pill taken for daily support of the urinary tract to prevent ongoing UTIs. PACs are also the antioxidant of the cranberry and provide other gut health benefits.

For those patients who are chronic and are looking for a stronger approach to prevent UTIs, we recommend taking UTI Control and D-Mannose together.

settings.title: Can I take D-Mannose and UTI Control (36mg PAC) at the same time?
settings.text: We recommend taking D-Mannose a few hours apart from Utiva UTI Control Cranberry PACs. There is research that discusses how dmannose and PACs could have their effectiveness reduced when taken together. We are investigating this further. With complicated or trigger associated UTI patients, doctors often recommend both products together with a probiotic.

settings.title: How long does it take for Utiva UTI Control to work?
settings.text: Utiva UTI Control can provide benefits almost immediately in terms of how you feel. For long term UTI prevention, it is best advised to take Utiva daily and observe the benefits of breaking away from UTIs or experience a huge reduction of UTI reoccurences. Antibiotics are always required to clear the infection and then the real long term prevention kicks in!

settings.title: Do I need to stop taking Utiva UTI Control while on antibiotics?
settings.text: Utiva UTI Control is safe to take while on antibiotics and can also help ensure PACs are in your system to prevent further bacteria from sticking.

settings.title: Does the Probiotic Power interact with other supplements and antibiotics?
settings.text: When taking antibiotics, it is recommended to take any probiotic 2-3 hours before/after taking your antibiotic. Aside from this, there are no known interactions with Probiotic Power and any other medication or supplements.

settings.title: Do I need to refrigerate Probiotic Power?
settings.text: No. Utiva Probiotic Power is shelf stable at room temperature. Being individually packed in blister packs also ensures improved stability with less exposure to air. Should you wish to refrigerate it, there is no harm in doing so.

settings.title: Your story is powerful, and it can bring hope to others.
settings.name: TAMANA
Dr. Colleen McDermott
settings.description: Urogynecologist
settings.heading: “Managing urinary tract health can be complex.
settings.text:
Antibiotics are the first line treatment for UTIs, but there are clinically proven options that can help manage recurrences. When considering cranberry supplements, I recommend my patients to select a product that contains 36 mg of proanthocyanidins (PACs).

There is evidence that supports PACs as being the active molecule of the cranberry which helps stop bacteria from sticking to the bladder wall."

settings.name: Dr. Yanina barbalat
settings.description: Urologist
settings.heading: “Overuse of antibiotics is a concern"
settings.text: I always consider natural options to help manage urinary tract health in my patients. Utiva is a great, clean cranberry product which has been very effective in many of my patients.”

settings.name: Dr. Emily Rutledge
settings.description: Gynecologist
settings.heading: “My own experience using Utiva has been great.
settings.text:
I heard about Utiva through one of the attending physicians who is training me in my fellowship, Dr. Fiona Lindo. She had come across Utiva at a medical conference and saw that the price of Utiva was extremely competitive compared to others on the market.

We are always looking for ways to decrease costs to patients when we’re asking them to try using several different medications or supplements.

The website is easy to use and setting up an automatic shipment of a 3-month supply has made me stay consistent with taking it and never running out (plus you get a little discount with the 3-month supply!)

There is a lot of high-quality evidence that shows that cranberry supplements are safe and effective at the appropriate doses. You can find all sorts of cranberry supplements in the ever-growing supplement aisle of the grocery store but if they don’t have that 36 mg PAC and measured by DMAC/A2 then they are a waste of money."

settings.name: ELAINE
settings.description: UTI episode gone bad
settings.heading: “I’ve had a few UTIs in my life, but the most memorable incident happened just before a trip I took overseas.
settings.text:
My doctor gave me antibiotics for a suspected UTI the same day of my flight. Sure enough, my antibiotic didn’t help and within a couple of days on vacation, my suspected UTI turned into a full-blown infection that travelled to my kidneys!

I ended up in a hospital where they didn’t speak English and I had to navigate myself through this foreign country to finally be on IV antibiotics. I was in so much pain, it was a nightmare! After this incident, I wanted to find a natural way to minimize the chance of this ever happening again. This is when I was introduced to Utiva Cranberry PACs.


Utiva has definitely helped me build up my confidence when travelling or in stressful situations where I now don't have to worry about my urinary tract health.

settings.name: JEFF
settings.description: Spinal Cord Injury & Catheter use
settings.heading: “Life as an incomplete quadriplegic is tough. I’ve been on a wheelchair for 17 years and have had to do self catheterizations about 5-6 times per day.
settings.text:
In my search for natural solutions, my holistic doctor introduced me to Utiva. I have been taking this fabulous product faithfully, one pill once a day, for the past 2 years.

This is the best cranberry supplement I’ve used! I haven’t had issues since I started Utiva and I love that the company is very approachable If you need information or help with the product. If you suffered from this like I did you’ve gotta try Utiva!”

settings.name: TAMANA
settings.description: Family History
settings.heading: “Because of my busy work schedule, I sometimes would end up drinking less water than usual and this would trigger UTI symptoms.
settings.text:
For me, this was an immediate red flag because I had seen my mother suffer from this issue and experience severe complications. Seeing first-hand how UTIs impacted her lifestyle and debilitated her overall health, was hard especially because I know it could have been prevented; however, women are often shy to discuss these topics in Indian culture, so they end up suppressing the pain and agony they are going through.

My mother’s battle with urinary tract issues motivated me to find a natural solution and I have been taking Utiva regularly for almost 3 years as a daily supplement. Since I started Utiva I have been healthy.

settings.name: KATHY
settings.description: Overuse of antibiotics
settings.heading: “I've regularly had easily identified full-blown UTIs treated with a variety of antibiotics.
settings.text:
A few years ago, two prescriptions of antibiotics let me down, and I went to the ER where doctors, puzzled by results from standard tests for UTIs, eventually concluded that this UTI was antibiotic resistant. This caused serious concern as specialists discussed within my hearing that the strongest antibiotic that could possibly work could also kill me!! Well, it didn't. Their battery of tests indicated that I had an extremely low iron level, and I was given a transfusion.
 
Anyway, some months ago, while traveling in Europe, I felt generally unwell but chalked it up to a period of high stress before leaving home.  I boarded my flight home from Frankfurt still feeling blah but okay. I chatted with my seat mates, ate a meal and then, very suddenly, began to feel incredibly cold. Blanket upon blanket didn't help. Then came the tremors, and I slipped off my seat onto the floor. Two doctors and a nurse on the flight came to my immediate rescue, supported by flight attendants. I was able to provide essential information and then PASSED OUT for the remaining four hours of the flight.
 
I woke up in the Hospital and have no reliable memory of texting my ex-husband. I do recall having a panic attack combined with an asthma attack, both terrifying. In ICU, I remained largely unconscious for hours, finally waking up in a ward with a patient suffering dementia whose screams sparked hallucinations. I was in my hospital bed trying to back through the wall out of the room! I remained in hospital for 12 days,  diagnosed with a SILENT UTI which, apparently, had been brewing during my three-week travels. I was shocked as I'd had no forewarning. This silent UTI resulted in SEPSIS, a potentially lethal condition caused by the body's extreme response to infection.  
 
I was exceptionally lucky that it didn't strike until I was on my home where I received excellent care at an early stage of sepsis. Sepsis prevents your blood from circulating through your body to major organs, causing organ failure and tissue damage. Amputations aren't uncommon. My recovery took about six months.  
 
I learned of Utiva through a friend and am so very relieved to have found it. I take it daily along with a capsule of D-Mannose and, for the first time in years, I feel healthy. Whew!!”

settings.name: SANDRA
settings.description: Urinary Tract Health
settings.heading: “Those of us who suffer know how frustrating it can be.
settings.text: Instead of antibiotics every time, I tried to find natural options so I didn’t have to put my body through so much medication.  I discovered Utiva in one of my searches and started to look more into this 36mg PAC formulation. I had taken a bunch of cranberry pills before but none of them worked. I’ve been taking Utiva for almost 2 years now. I finally feel like I have control once again over my body.

settings.name: ALAINA
settings.description: MS impacted my urinary tract health
settings.heading: "About 3 years ago I started getting UTIs. And it didn’t start out that bad; I wasn’t getting a lot of them but then all of the sudden they became more frequent and got a lot worse.
settings.text:
I went from having a UTI here and there to having Chronic UTIs. I ended up have a severe bladder infection that resulted in me having cystitis for 6 months and basically left me bed ridden. If you don’t know what that is its inflammation of the bladder. This was the most painful and debilitating experience I have ever had.

It felt like a knife was stabbing my bladder and I had very bad nerve pain in the vaginal region that was torture. It also killed to be peeing lots of blood all the time. This pain was constant, I very rarely had a down time with no pain. Every time I had to pee it also felt like a very bad stabbing pain too. I scream and yelled everyday almost all day long. And I never could sleep, I would be up all night in pain.

My doctors kept wanting to cover up the pain with pain meds like a Band-Aid, so I decided to see a naturopath who specializes in bladder health.

I am so thankful I decided to see her because she cured me from cystitis. She has me taking certain supplements and herbs to help me with my bladder health, and one of the most recent supplements she has put me on is Utiva. Ever since I started taking them a couple of months ago, I haven’t had any infections and my bladder health feels more secure and protected. I am so thankful for this product, and I am definitely going to stay on it for the rest of my life.”

settings.name: ANDREA DONSKY
settings.description: Bladder health due to menopause
settings.heading: “I started taking Utiva because I was experiencing bladder issues as I went into menopause.
settings.text: Since taking it daily, I no longer feel the sudden urge to urinate several times a day, and overall I feel like my bladder health has improved a lot. I highly recommend women in peri menopause and menopause take 1 capsule of Utiva daily to help maintain healthy urinary bacteria levels.”

settings.name: KIM
settings.description: Urinary Tract Health
settings.heading: “I was married 6 months before my journey started in 2012 as a DVT blood clot led to my cancer diagnosis with subsequent chemo, radiation and brachytherapy treatments put me in into menopause at age 37.
settings.text:
I also had surgery to remove 22 lymph nodes in my lower half of my body and because of the removal I have lymphedema.   

After my cancer treatment finished, I gained weight and then got diagnosed with type two diabetes.  Shortly after being diagnosed with diabetes, I started getting UTIs every six weeks then every three weeks.  I would have to take 10 days’ worth of antibiotics to clear up my infection.

I did not leave my house much but if I did, I would have to plan routes around clean washrooms, but the downside to leaving the couch was a UTI. I started looking for natural ways to help with prevention —every possible solution at health food stores I tried, and nothing worked. My oncologist suggested drinking pure cranberry juice which burned my throat and gave me stomach aches. 

In 2018 after being told I am resistant to all antibiotics, I started googling how to manage my urinary tract health and came across Utiva and after speaking with Derek I decided to give it a try! 

A month after trying Utiva I had my first appointment to see a urologist at Sunnybrook Hospital and he also recommended Utiva.

Utiva has given me my life back and I am no longer bound to my couch.  No longer experience pressure, frequent urination, up all night from going to the washroom and I can leave my house without a worry! 

We are all in this together and my hope is that we can all support each other in our quest to enjoy a healthy urinary tract! Welcome!”

settings.name: Natalie Pagura
settings.description: Urinary Tract Health
settings.heading: “My mother suffered for 6 months.
settings.text:
On numerous times she was admitted to the hospital because of how bad her body started reacting to the infections. She had to be put on antibiotics that were administered through an IV to clear the infections.

I felt horrible for the pain that she was always in! After trying numerous products, I researched ways to help her and came across the Utiva. After looking into it, I purchased 3 months’ worth for her and told her to start taking it right away.

This past January she was diagnosed with breast cancer and since then has had surgery and just completed her radiation. Throughout this entire process she has continued to take her Utiva to help manage her urinary tract health. It will be almost 9 months since staring Utiva and I can't believe the difference.

My mom is a fighter, she is strong, and she is brave, but the pain of her suffering was worrying her to no end. Even going through cancer and having a compromised immune system. I honestly believe in this product and cannot thank you enough! Utiva is definitely a life saver!”

settings.name: George Dracopoulos
settings.description: Compromised Immune System
settings.heading: "My mother's battle actually began several years ago when she was first diagnosed with NHL cancer, which has triggered alot of other unwanted and very unbearable side-effects
settings.text:
Her chemo treatments beat the cancer, but she endured problems along the way, such as continued coughing problems. Her cough has yet to be resolved, and unfortunately her bladder issues were only made worse by her lingering cough.

It wasn't until she consulted her urologist, Dr. Chang, that my mother was able to gain some sense of relief she so deserved, by taking Utiva. To this day, her symptoms have been well managed through the use of Utiva. Within 2-3 months my mother noticed incredible results.

My mother and I are very grateful to Dr. Chang for recommending Utiva, a simply awesome, must-have product! Thanks a million, Utiva!!"

settings.name: Teresa Arnfinson
settings.description: Suffering since childhood
settings.heading: "I am a busy mom of 4. I have struggled almost my entire life. Even as a child. As I have gotten older it has gotten significantly worse and most of my bugs quickly travel to my kidneys, resulting in IV antibiotics.
settings.text:
For the last 4 years I have been on regular daily/weekly
antibiotics to try to manage. When a bladder specialist recommended Utiva I thought
she was nuts. I already was talking tons of cranberry pills and still needed the antibiotics. I decided to try, and I am thrilled to say It has been 4 months with no antibiotics!! That may seem like a short time for some but for me that is HUGE!

I am so pleased to have been recommended your product and so happy I took a chance to try it!! Thank you Utiva. I’m feeling so much better now and have more time for my kids."

settings.name: Laurie Finaldi
settings.description: Years battling urinary tract health issues
settings.heading: "I am a flight attendant and been suffering for the past 6 years.
settings.text:
One night in the middle of my flight at about 4 in the morning I got a huge pain I went to the washroom on the plane feeling like urinate. To my surprise, I saw the bowl full of blood and I got so scared. As soon as we landed I went straight to the ER. The doctor wanted a urine test but the only thing we had was a little container full of blood. They then put me an IV and waiting for text results.

I went on antibiotics for 3 years then my doctor said to try Utiva . I called the number for Utiva to order my pills and spoke to Kim who was extremely helpful and I've been well every since . No more pain or blood in my urine.

I recommend to everyone whenever I go. Even to my eye doctor. She had the same problem and ever since she takes Utiva she is well. Thank you for those capsules they are a miracle to me!"

settings.name: Annette
settings.description: Urinary Tract Health after having children
settings.heading: "I have been suffering since I had my daughter.
settings.text:
I truly thought that this was the way it would be for the rest of my life. The constant having to find bathrooms and wear pads when they were not readily available was truly embarrassing.

I was on countless rounds of antibiotics...more than I can count. My doctor recommended your amazing product and with much skepticism, I bought a package.

Surprising, I went a full month without antibiotics so now I just don't go a day without taking them. Life changing!"

settings.bm_what_out_community_say_footer_para: Did you know that urinary tract infections are one of the most common infections seen by doctors in North America and experienced primarily by women? UTIs are also one of the main reasons antibiotics are prescribed and therefore a significant contributor to antibiotic resistance.

settings.bm_why_we_created_paragraph: With so much conflicting information out there, managing UTIs can be a confusing and stressful process. That's why we've put together this guide with the help of top healthcare professionals to provide UTI relief to anyone who needs it!

settings.bm_3_ways_this_uti_para1: Finding out what could be causing your UTIs is the first step to taking control and getting an effective UTI prevention plan in place.
settings.bm_3_ways_this_uti_para2: Managing UTIs can be difficult. We ensured we covered all topics like bladder-friendly foods, exercise, sex, menopause, travel and more. Implement these healthy practices where needed.

settings.bm_about_mission_description: Utiva was built on the belief that everyone deserves the best urinary tract health. Our vision is to provide the best-in-class natural solutions and support systems for urinary tract, bladder, and prostate health. Utiva is committed to educating and raising awareness on urinary tract health and empowering a healthy you.
settings.bm_about_description:
UTIs hit close to home in a real way. Our determination roots from
personal exposure with our families and the stories we hear everyday
from our customers.

settings.bm_about_our_story_description: I still remember hearing the difficult news that my grandma passed away at the young age of 51. With UTIs being a taboo subject, inconvenient access to care and her own ignorance, she neglected her UTI symptoms. As a result, she lost one of her kidneys and had severe complications since.

I was on the other side of the world while my wife was hospitalized. Before she left for her trip, she was prescribed antibiotics to treat a UTI. Little did we know, she was resistant to that antibiotic and the infection ended up traveling to her kidneys - all while I was unable to be there and help her.

settings.bm_about_advisory_slider_main_right_text: Utiva is a brand built by a team who have strong desire to educate and help patients achieve success with chronic genitourinary problem. They offer so much more than high quality supplements. They are offering the opportunity to educate and further the conversation on urinary health treatment strategies.

Managing recurrent urinary tract infections can be hard. Antibiotics are the first line treatment, but there are clinically proven options that can help prevent. When considering cranberry supplements, I recommend my patients select a product that contains 36mg of PACs

Lately, through virtual encounters, I have been recommending to all patients with recurrent conditions, to use Utiva to minimize the need for antibiotics and reduce the change of an ET visit, particularly during this COVID-19 pandemic crisis.

Natural products, like cranberries, can aid in natural flushing and the improvement of urinary tract health. Not all cranberry products are the same and attention should be given to those with the right amount of the active ingredient from the cranberry (Proanthocyanidins). These are still not a cure but have some evidence to show to help minimize the need for prophylactic antibiotic usage.

settings.doctors_paragraph: Managing recurrent urinary tract infections can be hard. Antibiotics are the first line treatment, but there are clinically proven options to help prevent. When considering cranberry supplements, recommend my patients select a product with 36 mg of PACs.

Through my clinical research on patients with overactive bladder, believe the proprietary blend of cranberry in Utiva Bladder Health is safe and has efficacy comparable to other common medications for OAB. It helps in treating symptoms of OAB by reducing urinary urgency episodes and frequency

There is an active molecule in cranberries called proanthocyanidins (PACs). According to clinical studies you need 36 mg PACs to prevent bacteria from forming an infection in the urinary tract. Utiva is the only brand that has the right dose of cranberry PACs to help prevent UTIs.

settings.review_description: I had NON-STOP chronic bladder infections; one after the other for the past year. My Urologist said to me . . . "Use this and you'll never have another UTI". Strong words coming from a doctor, and he gave me the Utiva Pamphlet. I gave it a shot and I haven't had one single UTI since I started Utiva. If you suffer like I did, PLEASE GIVE IT A TRY. You've got nothing to lose, and a normal life to gain back!

I tried the probiotic supplement after having been very pleased with the cranberry supplement over the last 6 months or so. I love the probiotic supplement too. It is easy on the stomach and causes me no digestive issues. Ordering online is easy and shipping was quick. I am very happy with Utiva. I have also attended their online presentations and have learned a lot.

This really works!!! Game changing product. I've taken this for months, and when taken correctly, it prevents UTIs. Saves me from making doctors visits and being put on antibiotics, which we can grow a tolerance to. This is a more natural way to prevent the situation, before it happens.

I was pleasantly surprised by how quickly I started noticing changes. Within the first few weeks I noticed less urgency and frequency in needing the bathroom. Symptoms have continued to improve at the 3 month mark now and I am very happy!! A quality product with excellent results and quick shipping.
